name: Curcumin
overview: Curcumin is the natural yellow pigment extracted from turmeric root (Curcuma longa).
typical_uses: Curry powders, mustards, butter, cheese, beverages, confectionery, bakery products.
effects_summary: Generally recognized as safe; may have anti-inflammatory properties.
sources: [{"title": "FSA: Approved additives & E numbers", "url": "https://www.food.gov.uk/business-guidance/approved-additives-and-e-numbers"}, {"title": "EFSA re-evaluation of curcumin (E100)", "url": "https://www.efsa.europa.eu/en/efsajournal/pub/6267"}]

name: Riboflavin
overview: Riboflavin (Vitamin B2) used as yellow-orange colour and nutritional supplement.
typical_uses: Energy drinks, breakfast cereals, baby foods, dairy products.
effects_summary: Essential B vitamin; beneficial for health.
